lead_paragraph: A Sports of The Times column on Aug. 16 about Nastia Liukin’s gold medal in the gymnastics all-around at the Beijing Olympics — a prize that eluded her father, Valeri Liukin, at the 1988 Summer Games — misidentified the gymnast who narrowly defeated him for the all-around that year. It was Vladimir Artemov — not Vladimir Artemev, another elite gymnast from the same era.
